intro: Oryctanthus botryostachys, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form with narrow, leathery leaves. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences of pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
